name: National Guard Tuition Incentive Program
description: Provides $2,500 semiannually (up to $5,000 annually) for Arkansas National Guard members attending Arkansas institutions. Subject to funding availability.
eligibility: Active Arkansas National Guard member in good standing
how_to_apply: Apply through Arkansas National Guard Education Office
source_name: Arkansas National Guard

name: Arkansas National Guard Tuition Waiver Program (NGTW)
description: Waives up to 120 credit hours OR until completion of bachelor's degree (whichever first) for Arkansas National Guard members at state-supported public institutions. NGTW applied to tuition first, then military education benefits cover additional costs. Covers mandatory fees but NOT books or other fees. Apply each semester.
benefit_amount: Up to 120 credit hours OR bachelor's degree (tuition + mandatory fees)
how_to_apply: Apply each semester through Arkansas National Guard Education Office
source_name: Arkansas National Guard

name: Military Dependents Scholarship Program
description: Undergraduate financial aid (tuition waiver) at Arkansas state institution for spouse or dependent child of Arkansas veterans killed in action, missing in action, POW, or totally and permanently disabled as result of service.
eligibility: Spouse OR dependent child of Arkansas veteran
Veteran KIA, MIA, POW, OR totally and permanently disabled from service
how_to_apply: Apply through Arkansas Department of Veterans Affairs
source_name: Arkansas Department of Veterans Affairs

name: In-State Tuition for Veterans and Dependents
description: Arkansas public institutions grant residency for tuition purposes to eligible nonresident veterans (honorable discharge after 90+ days within 3 years), active service members, spouses, and dependents.
eligibility: Veteran discharged honorably after 90+ days within 3 years of enrollment
how_to_apply: Submit DD-214 or military documentation to institution
source_name: Arkansas Department of Higher Education

name: High School Credits for Basic Training
description: Arkansas high school students receive 2 units of Career Focus credit for completing Basic Training prior to high school graduation. Must have enlisted through Delayed Entry Program or National Guard Split Training Option.
eligibility: Enlisted via Delayed Entry Program OR Guard Split Training Option
benefit_amount: 2 Career Focus credits toward high school graduation
how_to_apply: Contact high school counselor with Basic Training completion documentation
source_name: Arkansas Department of Education

name: Honorary High School Diploma
description: WWII, Korea, and Vietnam veterans called to active duty before finishing high school may receive honorary high school diploma.
eligibility: Called to active duty before completing high school
how_to_apply: Contact local school district
source_name: Arkansas Department of Education

name: 100% Property Tax Exemption for Disabled Veterans
description: Veterans 100% service-connected disabled OR awarded Special Monthly Compensation for loss/loss of use of limbs OR total blindness are exempt from ALL state taxes on homestead and personal property. Act 876 of 2025 amended to require Summary of Benefits letter only ONCE (no annual resubmission). Extends to unremarried widows/widowers and dependent minor children if veteran KIA, MIA, or died from service causes.
eligibility: 100% service-connected disabled OR SMC for limbs/blindness
OR unremarried surviving spouse/minor children (veteran KIA/MIA/service death)
Submit Summary of Benefits letter once
benefit_amount: 100% exemption from all homestead + personal property taxes
how_to_apply: Submit VA Summary of Benefits letter to County Collector once; notify of status changes
source_name: Arkansas Department of Finance and Administration

name: Military Pay Income Tax Exemption
description: Military pay earned by service members in active or reserve segments is NOT subject to Arkansas income tax. Includes National Guard and Reserve members. Additional pay and allowances also exempt.
eligibility: Arkansas resident on active duty OR Guard/Reserve
how_to_apply: Exclude from Arkansas income tax return
source_name: Arkansas Department of Finance and Administration

name: Military Retirement Pay Tax Exemption (Act 141 of 2018)
description: Beginning 2018, Arkansas military retirement pay is FULLY exempt from state taxes, thanks to Act 141 of Arkansas' 91st General Assembly. Complete exemption for all military retirees.
how_to_apply: Exclude from Arkansas income tax return
source_name: Arkansas Department of Finance and Administration

name: Guard/Reserve Overnight Travel Expense Exemption
description: National Guard and Reserve members may exclude overnight travel expenses required for military duty from Arkansas income tax.
eligibility: Arkansas National Guard OR Reserve member
Overnight travel expenses for military duty
benefit_amount: Exemption on overnight travel expenses for duty
how_to_apply: Exclude from Arkansas income tax return
source_name: Arkansas Department of Finance and Administration

name: Principal Residence Sale Profit Exemption
description: Service members may exclude profits from sale of their principal residence from Arkansas income tax.
eligibility: Selling principal residence due to military orders
how_to_apply: Exclude from Arkansas income tax return
source_name: Arkansas Department of Finance and Administration

name: Arkansas Service Members Civil Relief Act
description: Provides tax deferral for 180 days if unable to pay due to military service. NO interest or penalty accrues during deferral. Statute of limitations suspended for military service period + 270 days.
eligibility: Unable to pay taxes due to military service
benefit_amount: 180-day tax deferral with no interest/penalty; statute suspended
how_to_apply: Contact Arkansas Department of Finance and Administration
source_name: Arkansas Department of Finance and Administration

name: Blind Veteran Vehicle Sales Tax Exemption
description: Veterans blind from service-connected injury get tax exemption on gross receipts/proceeds from sale of NEW automobile. VA entitlement letter required. One vehicle every 2 years.
benefit_amount: Sales tax exemption on one new vehicle every 2 years
how_to_apply: Present VA entitlement letter to dealer
source_name: Arkansas Department of Finance and Administration

name: Adaptive Equipment Sales Tax Exemption
description: Tax exemption on gross receipts/proceeds from sale of motor vehicles and adaptive equipment purchased with VA financial assistance.
eligibility: VA provided financial assistance for adaptive equipment/vehicle
benefit_amount: Sales tax exemption on VA-assisted vehicle/equipment purchases
how_to_apply: Present VA assistance documentation to seller
source_name: Arkansas Department of Finance and Administration

name: Veterans Employment Hiring Preference
description: Veterans receive preference in Arkansas state employment (hiring, promotions, retention). Additional points added to passing exam scores. If veteran not chosen, can request base score, adjusted score, and selected candidate's score. Also applies to Guard/Reserve and surviving spouses.
eligibility: Arkansas veteran OR National Guard/Reserve member OR surviving spouse
benefit_amount: Hiring preference + exam points + retention priority
how_to_apply: Indicate veteran status on state employment applications
source_name: Arkansas Department of Transformation and Shared Services

name: State Employee Military Leave
description: Arkansas National Guard and Reserve members who are state employees receive leave for military duty.
how_to_apply: Follow state employee military leave procedures
source_name: Arkansas Department of Transformation and Shared Services

name: Disabled Military Veteran Lifetime Hunting and Fishing Licenses
description: Resident disabled military veterans receive lifetime hunting, fishing, or combination licenses at discounted rates. Available at Little Rock office and by mail.
how_to_apply: Apply at Arkansas Game and Fish Commission Little Rock office or by mail
source_name: Arkansas Game and Fish Commission

name: Military Retiree Lifetime Hunting and Fishing Licenses
description: Resident military retirees receive lifetime fishing, hunting, or combination licenses. Available at Little Rock office and by mail.
how_to_apply: Apply at Arkansas Game and Fish Commission Little Rock office or by mail
source_name: Arkansas Game and Fish Commission

name: Half-Price State Park Camping (100% Disabled)
description: Arkansas resident veterans with permanent service-connected 100% disability rate receive year-round camping at HALF PRICE in Arkansas State Parks. Proof required: Awards letter (dated within 2 years) OR Arkansas DV license plate.
eligibility: VA Awards letter (within 2 years) OR DV license plate
benefit_amount: 50% discount on state park camping year-round
how_to_apply: Present VA Awards letter or DV license plate at state park
source_name: Arkansas Department of Parks and Tourism

name: Professional License Portability
description: Arkansas dedicated to supporting active duty, returning veterans, and spouses with licensure portability. Most accepting laws and regulations for licensure portability in US. Straightforward transition for professional licenses across jurisdictions.
eligibility: Active duty service member OR veteran OR military spouse
how_to_apply: Contact Arkansas licensing board for profession
source_name: Arkansas Professional Licensing Boards
